data.title: A review of the biology, distribution, and management challenges posed by the invasive weed <i>Ziziphus mauritiana<
data.meta_description: AbstractZiziphus mauritiana is an economically detrimental and environmentally destructive plant in non‐native areas where it has escaped cultivation. It forms dense, impenetrable thickets that restrict the movement of livestock across the landscape and has the capacity to alter various ecological functions at the site of invasion, all of which contribute towards land degradation and the reduction of economic profitability. Although there are several management strategies implemented to control Z. mauritia…
data.text: Number of works in the list of references 42
